title: Disney superfans are offered $1,000 to watch 30 movies in just one month
text:
A company is offering Disney fans the chance to earn $1,000 — and all they have to do is watch 30 movies in 30 days.

Reviews.org is hiring up to five Disney fans to celebrate the launch of the new Disney+ streaming service, which will go live on Nov. 12.

Those selected for what the organization is calling 'the Disney+ dream job' will be expected to watch 30 movies on the platform in 30 days and then report back.

Exciting news: Reviews.org is hiring up to five Disney fans to watch 30 movies on Disney+ in 30 days for $1,000

Ready to apply? The application entails answering questions and submitting a video explaining why the applicant is the ultimate Disney fan

Requirements: Applicants must be 18 years or older and be a permanent resident of the US

'Do you sing along with your kiddos when they belt out "Let It Go"? (Or maybe when you’re alone in the shower?) Is Halloween the perfect time to live out your dreams of becoming a pretty princess or spectacular superhero? We think you’d be perfect for the job!” the company wrote in the posting.

Applicants have to prove they are ultimate Disney fans when submitting their applications to win the coveted role.

They must answer a series of questions before submitting a video reviewing their favorite Disney movie. Applicants also must be 18 years or older and a US citizen or permanent resident.

Those selected with be expected to watch 30 movies in 30 days, and for that they'll receive $1,000, a one-year Disney+ subscription, and a Disney-themed movie kit to make the experience more fun.

The movie kit will include a blanket, cups, popcorn popper, and popcorn kernels.

Dream job: Winners will receive $1,000 for then watching 30 movies in 30 days on Disney+

This news comes after Disney announced last week all the movies that would be up on the streaming service come Nov. 12.

For $7 per month, fans will have access to a variety of movies and series including Frozen, Star Wars, Marvel, and The Simpsons.

The company is also planning on launching series and movies directly to the streaming service, similar to what Netflix and Hulu currently do with their own subscription sites.

Verizon also announced on Tuesday it would be offering new and current customers a one year subscription to Disney+ in honor of the new streaming service.

Disney anticipates it will have an estimated 60 to 90 million global subscribers to its streaming service by 2025, CNN reports.
description: Reviews.org is offering the job for up to five Disney fans to experience. Applicants must be 18 years or older and be a permanent resident of the US.
